Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a pointed oval carinated body and rounded shoulders decorated with cable pattern. On top is a scallop-shell with Eros asleep, holding a cup in his right hand. A bow and arrow flank the nozzle. The wick-hole is set off by a ridge and a row of raised points. Within the undefined pointed oval base is an impressed bound triple branch, above which is a Greek name. The nozzle is broken. Brown, micaceous clay. Plaster mould.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1970)
